comments: Or, numerator of n/(n+12).Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 2^max(0, e-2), a(3^e) = 3^max(0,e-1), a(p^e) = p^e otherwise. - _David W. Wilson_, Jun 12 2005
references: R. L. Graham, D. E. Knuth and O. Patashnik, Concrete Mathematics. Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, 1990, p. 269.
links: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = n/GCD(n, 12). - _David W. Wilson_, Jun 12 2005From _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 18 2011: (Start)a(n) = A109053(n)/12.Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s-1)*(1 - 2/3^s - 1/2^s + 2/6^s - 1/4^s + 2/12^s). (End)
prog: (Sage) [lcm(n,12)/12for n in xrange(0, 72)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 09 2009(MAGMA) [Numerator(n/12): n in [0..100]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 18 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
